text: MELBOURNE World number one Ash Barty withdrew from the Australian Open doubles on Friday, raising concerns over her fitness for the singles as she manages a thigh strain.Barty played with her left thigh heavily strapped in her second round win over fellow Australian Daria Gavrilova but downplayed the injury on Thursday, saying she was fit as a fiddle.She and American Jennifer Brady were scheduled to play in the second round of the womens doubles on Friday but withdrew from the match, handing Elise Mertens and Aryna Sabalenka a walkover.Top seed Barty, who made the semi-finals last year, is bidding to end Australias 43-year wait for a home winner at the Grand Slam.
